# text = Several related issues have resulted in an increase in the level of operating risk for the Merchanting Metals business.
# text = Complexities surrounding the operation of the Off Balance Sheet Facility ("OBSF") which commenced two weeks before the year end.
# text = The uncertainty generated by the revocation of AA's signoff for the facility late in the year end audit.
# text = The discovery of a number of 'bugs' within the AS400 Merchanting code, arising from the release of OBSF designed functionality, which compounded the operational burden of supporting the OBSF.
# text = The requirement to amend the operational process and OBSF IT code as a result of the current renegotiation of the OBSF with Barclays ( and AA ).
# text = The senior IT developer for Merchanting has resigned and been sent on gardening leave.
# text = The Corporate requirement to lower working capital usage for the Merchanting business irrespective of the above parochial business issues.
# text = Various mitigating actions have been and will be taken to provide focus, gain comfort over control levels and to provide assurance to senior management as to the accuracy of the Q1 DPR and business balance sheet.
# text = The implementation for SAP for the Merchanting business has been delayed and effectively decoupled from the higher risk ( higher benefit ) Brokerage implementation - benefit is to provide sole focus on OBSF for IT Merchanting developers.
# text = The AR/AP SAP data quality reviews for both businesses are continuing so as to provide a detailed analysis as at end Q1.
# text = Middle Office have instigated a new daily working capital report process tracking cash settlement/ funding data to working capital components for all Metals businesses.
# text = An enhanced position signoff process will be implemented prior to end Q1 covering gross tonnage, spread positions and summarised analyses for brand and locations.
# text = The necessary report functionality should be available within the AS400, however contingencies have been initiated to build tactical VBA/excel reports outside of the AS400 but using AS400 data downloads.
# text = User requests for additional AS400 functionality and reports have been aggressively prioritised and a code freeze will commence prior to the end of Q1 following the delivery of three reports determined as minimum requirements for the support of OBSF.
# text = A resubstantiation of the full Q1 DPR will be completed by the Risk control staff reconciling the full trial balances between Q1 open and Q1 close
# text = A full internal balance sheet review will be completed within the Q1 audit timetable which incorporates
# text = A full circularisation of inventory balances, and matching to source documentation within Enron

# text = Would you please contact Gerald Nemec and review the Gallup Compression Service Contract in respect to the Load Control Management.
# text = My understanding was that ECS was to provide a means to access CDEC's online profile in order for us to make a decision to avoid running the compressor during CDEC's peak load periods.
# text = We have not received access to this information which has resulted so far in additional electric cost of $200,987.33 for the period of July through September.
# text = Additional cost will be incurred for the remainder of this year, that I have not been able to review yet.
# text = This cost is averaging $79,000 per month if we continue to run the compressor as we have in August and September.
# text = Good point, but I'm comfortable we're covered because our bidders were all bidding on a chunk of capacity and primary points.
# text = They are deemed to be on notice that they had alternate point rights (its in the tariff) and if they wanted to submit a bid that had a different rate for primaries and alternates, they could have done so.
# text = None of them did, and most importantly, the winning bidders did not.
# text = Our letter agreement simply memorializes that we will charge the same negotiated rate whether the gas flows on primaries or alternates.
# text = I assume from your message you are OK with this and they can get it nailed down?
# text = DF
# text = I just got done looking at the underlying contract language as set forth in the pro forma service agreement in the tariff and it specifically says that the max rate would apply unless a discount or negotiated rate has been agreed to.
# text = My concern with adding the language below is, could it be argued that not everyone knew the rate would or could apply at any point, since we just stated Topack and Needles and if they knew they might have bid a different rate??

# text = Bill
# text = Bill -
# text = If Sam's description below of the GCP procedure is correct, it looks to me like something needs to be changed.
# text = The difficulty lies in the fact that the confirmation system reads the counterparty's name from Global Counterparty.
# text = Since divisions of companies are not legal entities they do not have the power to contract in their own names.
# text = If the correct legal name is not in Global Counterparty, the confirmation goes out with the wrong legal name on it seriously compromising the contract itself.
# text = That is the source of Tana's concern regarding the correct entering of divisions in the system.
# text = My suggestion is that Global Counterparty use the same name that the customer has signed on the EnronOnline Password Application -- my understanding is that the EnronOnline team returns inappropriate Applications to the customer until they are correctly completed.
# text = In this particular case since the counterparty is still not allowed to transact on EnronOnline almost a month after sending in their application they are understandably upset and are now complaining.
# text = I would appreciate it if you could get this one fixed today and, if you have any problem with changing the GCP procedure, please let me know.
# text = Mark

# text = <<1%P701!.doc>>
# text = Note that this communication is confidential, covered by CA's settlement rules.
# text = "Lindh, Frank (Law)" <FRL3@pge.com>
# text = 12/21/2000 07:50 PM
# text = Confidential Settlement Document Per CPUC Rule 51
# text = Gas Accord II Settlement Participants:
# text = Attached is PG&E's Gas Accord II (GA II) Settlement Proposal.
# text = We believe it addresses many of the issues and concerns you have raised in the workshops.
# text = As an overview, this proposal: * Maintains the basic Gas Accord structure in place today for the period 2003 to 2007. *
# text = * Offers end user transportation rates for 2003 lower for most customers than rates in effect today. *
# text = * Provides for vintaged Redwood path rates for core customers. *
# text = * Offers a 7.5 cent/dth rate to large customers while minimizing rate changes to other customers, minimizing the incentive for these customers to seek to bypass local transmission charges and other CPUC-approved charges. *
# text = * Adopts guidelines to improve reliability and help moderate prices in gas commodity markets, and identifies the capital projects needed to meet these guidelines over the course of the GA II period (2003-2007). *
# text = * Provides a high degree of rate stability, with a 3.5% escalator to capture both inflation and the cost of needed capital projects.
# text = The guaranteed rates will be adjustable only for significant changes in the cost of capital or increased costs due to governmental requirements or catastrophic events. *
# text = * Preserves a rate differential between the Redwood and Baja paths, although somewhat less than the current differential. *
# text = * Proposes a two-stage open season for firm transportation services beginning in 2003, with end users receiving a first option on available capacity. *
# text = * Maintains the core aggregation program with some adjustments.
# text = PG&E also anticipates that the Core Procurement Incentive Mechanism (CPIM) will be similar to today's mechanism, but will reflect the somewhat larger capacity holdings needed to meet anticipated increases in core demand and to meet a 1-day in 10-year cold weather event.
# text = This also will serve as a reminder that an all-Party meeting is scheduled at PG&E's headquarters in San Francisco on January 10 and 11, to discuss this proposal and to respond to your questions.
# text = We look forward to answering your questions and receiving your feedback.
# text = The attached documents include the GA II Settlement proposal, an Attachment (a copy of PG&E's proposed Gas Rule 27), and a set of supporting workpapers.
# text = Finally, please note that the Settlement document and the Attachment are in "Word 2000" format.
# text = We would be glad to provide the same documents in an earlier version of Word, upon request by individual Parties.
# text = We look forward to seeing you on January 10-11.
# text = In the meantime, we extend our best wishes for a safe and happy holiday season.
# text = Frank Lindh Ray Williams (415) 973-2776 (415) 973-3634
# text = <<PG&E Gas Accord II Settlement Proposal 12-20-00.doc>> <<Proposed Gas Rule 27.doc>> <<COS & Rates Workpapers for GA II 12-20-2000 Proposal.xls>>

# text = Harry Kingerski
# text = 12/26/2000 03:33 PM
# text = Jeff -
# text = instead of suggesting a specific rate increase - 10 or 15 %, I think we should acknowledge that a "modest" increase may be necessary and may in fact be desirable - but that the specific amount of increase should be reasoned and subject to well thought out evidence and hearings, not just determined by whim.
# text = In general, we should not be overly prescriptive at this point and I know you agree with that.
# text = Otherwise, I think you have captured the points excellently.
# text = We're in the process of developing a strategy to take us through the next few months.
# text = But while the (otherwise perishable) thoughts are still fresh in my mind from the hearings on Monday and Tuesday, I wanted to throw out some observations for discussion in the days/weeks ahead.
# text = OBSERVATION--The pressure to finger somebody for "price gouging" is increasing.
# text = The administration is hell bent on finding a "fall guy."
# text = The price spikes pose real political risks for Davis and he and his folks need and want an easy way out.
# text = His press release following the hearing renewed the call for "refunds."
# text = On my panel, Loretta Lynch asked Reliant and Duke to supply her with the details of the contracts they cut to sell their power forward to marketers.
# text = And Carl Wood's remarks were extreme.
# text = At the Barton hearing, a liberal democrat (Filner) and a conservative Republican (Hunter) locked arms in calling for refunds.
# text = Bilbray joined the "gouging" band wagon.
# text = The utilities repeatedly called on FERC to do a "real" investigation, with hearings, testimony, data discovery---the works.
# text = On the positive side, the FERC commissioners lauded Wolak, his analysis, and his remarks on the panel.
# text = Wolak said somewhat emphatically that the nature of California's market structure makes it impossible to single out a single participant as the culprit.
# text = He also stated that just everyone's just acting in their own self-interest, responding to the screwed incentives embedded in the structure.
# text = IMPLICATION--It seems prudent for Enron to understand better its risks of getting fingered.
# text = In the best case, the clamoring for a "refund" subsides.
# text = In which case, the only cost to Enron is the internal cost incurred to understand better the risks of getting fingered.
# text = In the medium case, investigations find that Enron (like others) "played by the rules," but the rules stunk, and Enron profited at the expense of California consumers.
# text = You're right, Sue.
# text = Rates can't go up w/out declaring the rate freeze over in some fashion---trying to finesse it.
# text = Thanks very much for the comments.
# text = Harry also had a good comment---don't specify the amount of rate increase in our comments; rather note that the rate increase needs to be well-reasoned and based on facts and evidence.
# text = Will make that change.

# text = fyi
# text = Tom Byargeon, Kevin Miller and Ken Loch in ENA are working with producers in the US involved in deep water offshore Louisiana/Texas oil and gas drilling projects.
# text = This financing activity was primarily started to help ENA secure long term well head and pipeline natural gas supplies to supplement the gas trading desk activities.
# text = Just like what happened in Enron's initial VPP program they are find more interest in oil drilling projects rather than natural gas projects.
# text = They are currently working on a bid (due 1/31) for the Medusa project which involves Murphy (operator), Agip and Callon in Mississippi Canyon Blocks #538 and #582.
# text = The initial reservoir reports estimate reserves of 80-120 million barrels of sour crude and they estimate initial production to be 40,000 bpd starting in 1Q 2003.
# text = Quality is estimated to be a Mars type crude with 25-27 API Gravity and 1.5-2.0% sulfur.
# text = Plans are to build a private pipeline to Equilon's West Delta #143 platform and then bring the oil onshore.
# text = Peggy is finding out where WD #143 pumps to onshore.
# text = Tom's group would like to know if we have any interesting in buying the crude on either a fixed or floating basis.
# text = The floating could be tied to a Platt's index or the NYMEX.
# text = It is far too early to expect Murphy to enter into a physical or financial contract, but Tom hopes to get us first and/or last look from Murphy when the time is right.
# text = Another alternative is to give Murphy barrels at their 95,000 bpd Meraux, Louisiana refinery in exchange for the new production barrels.
# text = Could someone in your group please give me a notional non binding basis differential for this quality of crude for Cal 2003?
# text = please print
# text = 01/24/2001 01:02 PM
# text = Please address, and I'll check with Legal as well.
# text = We typically only book deals when everything is signed off.
# text = Jeff
# text = David Hoog
# text = 01/26/2001 09:37 AM
# text = following up on our discussion yesterday; for these types of deals, i dont think its necessary to have all the documentation of our counterparty's authorization to enter into the agreement.
# text = these are short term transactions and requiring this documentation will cause us to lose business because competitive alternatives do not have such burdensome requirements.
# text = the primary reason we need these things is for the scenario where a muni does a derivative deal with an open-ended downside, loses $50 million, and then claims that it was not a valid contract.
# text = in our case, they are only hedging.
# text = we are collecting a premium up front and their total cost is known up front.
# text = therefore they will not attempt to make this claim.
# text = even if they did, our risk is limited to the premium , not some big payout.
# text = the risk of losing business is far greater than the risk of a counterparty trying to get their premium back.
# text = seems like a 5 second decision to me.
# text = is it possible to combine the standard isda and our confirm into a single long form?
# text = by going away from the standard isda maybe we can eliminate these requirements because the payout liability is only 1-way.

# text = I have attempted to incorporate the changes that Jim has incorporated in our long form power agreement which ENA has suggested to date into the short form.
# text = Attached please find a sample short form (for the Con Ed market) for your review.
# text = Please note the following as you review:
# text = 1. The short forms do not contain the optionality relating to our performing billing services -- all of our midmarket forms anticipate that we will act as customer's billing agent and that we will collect all amounts due related to T&D and the like from the customer (and reflect same on our invoice) and pass those amounts on to the customer's utility.
# text = 2. I did not include a "Setoff" provision in this draft, mainly because the vast majority of the time, we will not, nor will an affiliate, have another agreement in place with these customers.
# text = If you feel strongly about our including a setoff provision, we will do so.
# text = 3. The change in law provision reads a bit differently from the long form -- the thinking here is that the long form language is very lengthy and rather harsh (and we've had great difficulty selling it in the past).
# text = Taking into consideration this class of customer, we decided to include certain items, including our inability to cover our costs due to a change in law, rules or practices as a "force majeure event" in an effort to soften the approach (see the GTCs).
# text = Also we do not address calculation of a termination payment in the event of a change in law as the long form does -- again, more in the interest of "saving space" than anything else...
# text = Let us know your thoughts on this document and if you are comfortable with our using this until such time as the hybrid form is launched.

# text = Probing the 'palace coup'
# text = Electricity: A panel focuses on price hikes and the actions of the ISO president.
# text = September 26, 2001
# text = By KIMBERLY KINDY
# text = The Orange County Register
# text = SACRAMENTO
# text = A state Senate committee is set today to start serving 16 subpoenas on electricity producers and officials who manage California's energy grid to determine whether they acted in concert to manipulate energy prices.
# text = The investigative committee, headed by state Sen. Joe Dunn, D-Santa Ana, is focusing on a series of events last fall filled with enough Shakespearean plot twists and intrigue that it has earned a name around the Capitol: "the palace coup."
# text = Lawmakers and consumer groups allege that the events - directed by the man who heads the state's energy grid - fueled the California energy crisis, pushed the state into the power-buying business and helped make billions of dollars for power producers.
# text = The central question behind the palace coup is whether Terry Winter, the president of the Independent System Operator, acted alone when he took steps to remove key price caps designed to limit the amount power generators could charge.
# text = Winter defied his own board and Gov. Gray Davis when he filed a 50-page request to remove the caps, records and interviews show.
# text = "I don't know how these events could have taken place without some concerted effort," said Dunn.
# text = The subpoenas will force those involved, including Winter, to provide sworn testimony about the events to the committee, and to turn over e-mails, personal calendars and memos.
# text = Davis spokesman Steve Maviglio said the governor felt "betrayed" by the actions of Winter.
# text = "The governor believes it was the defining moment, when what was a mounting problem turned into an instant crisis," Maviglio said.
# text = Winter refused comment, referring all questions to the public relations office.
# text = ISO spokesman Gregg Fishman said Dunn's committee will find no criminal conduct.
# text = The decision was made by ISO upper management with one goal in mind: to keep the lights on.
# text = At the time, generators were refusing to sell power in California because of the price caps.
# text = "It was an emergency," Fishman said.
# text = "We had to take action.''
# text = What became known as the palace coup began on Oct. 26 when ISO board members voted for severe restrictions on the amount of money electricity producers could charge for power.
# text = The restrictions would drive prices as low as $65 per megawatt - nearly 12 times below the $750 per megawatt limits of seven months earlier.
# text = "They (electricity generators) grinned and beared the $750 price cap, but this new plan by ISO was too much," said Dunn, whose committee has been investigating since March.
# text = "All hell broke loose.''
# text = Records show that on Oct. 31, power generators and electricity traders filed letters with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, demanding that the new plan be killed.
# text = The letters, six in all, were sent within two hours of each other and represented dozens of power generators.
# text = "If not removed immediately, the (ISO) price cap will sow confusion in the market, threaten reliability and stifle new investment in generating capacity,'' read one letter written by Duke Energy Vice President William Hall III.
# text = Although there is nothing illegal about the generators acting together to lobby against price caps, Dunn believes the letters and other actions around the same time showed clear coordination among energy officials.
# text = He said the main aim of the subpoenas will be to determine whether collusion occurred to "fix" prices, which would violate federal trade laws.
# text = In the Oct. 31 letters, electricity producers told federal officials that if price caps weren't removed it would lead to a collapse of the energy market.
# text = The generators got their way.
# text = The next day, the federal commission killed the new pricing plan.
# text = What was left in place was a $250 price cap established five months earlier.
# text = Power producers then turned their attention toward killing that cap, saying they couldn't make a profit even under these constraints.
# text = They began to withhold power from California, and on Dec. 7 the ISO declared its first Stage 3 emergency and braced for blackouts, which were narrowly averted.
# text = What followed the next day is considered by the governor and Dunn to be the pivotal moment of the energy crisis.
# text = Winter, who in his position as president and chief operating officer of the ISO, submitted a 50-page emergency request, asking federal officials to abolish the $250 price cap.
# text = Final authority over lifting the cap rested with the federal government.
# text = Neither the ISO board, which had established the price cap, nor the governor learned of Winter's actions until the cap had been removed.
# text = In fact, the attorney who helped draft the emergency request, Charles Robinson, was in a meeting with representatives of the governor and ISO board members just hours before the filing was made.
# text = He didn't mention anything about it.
# text = "In retrospect, we should have told them,'' Robinson said.
# text = With the price caps gone, the generators filed paperwork with federal regulators justifying higher costs.
# text = "The ISO staff sat in a meeting with the governor's key energy advisers with poker faces, not saying a word about something that was going on at the exact same moment,'' Maviglio said.
# text = "It was beyond belief that they failed to mention something so significant.
# text = This action accelerated the utilities' move toward bankruptcy and forced the governor to move the state into the power-buying business."
# text = Prices for electricity jumped from an average of $249 a megawatt to $700 a megawatt within three days, ISO records show.
# text = Dunn believes the resulting overcharges for electricity exceeded $30 billion.
# text = Robinson said the filing - granted two hours after the request - helped rather than hurt Californians.
# text = Prices, he said, did not spike as a result.
# text = Instead they followed the skyrocketing price of natural gas - which is used to run power plants to generate electricity.
# text = Robinson said the emergency order allowed the ISO to secure refunds should overcharges for electricity be proven to federal officials.
# text = "We believe the action we took addressed a severe concern,'' Robinson said.
# text = "In our view, we did not believe we changed or made worse the financial situation.
# text = We felt we made it better because it introduced a process for review and refund."
# text = Jan Smutney-Jones, who was the ISO board chairman at the time and executive director of a group that represents power generators, said Winter did not consult him about eliminating the price cap.
# text = Smutney-Jones also said he was unaware of anyone in the power-generating community being consulted.
# text = "Terry did this by himself,'' said Smutney-Jones, executive director of the Independent Energy Producers.
# text = "He did what he thought had to be done at the time to keep the power flowing."
# text = The ISO board called an emergency meeting the next week demanding Winter explain his actions.
# text = Some board members pushed to have Winter removed, but there were concerns such action would lead to more chaos, the governor's spokesman Maviglio said.
# text = James J. Hoecker, the former Federal Energy Regulatory Commission chairman, defended making the December decision and also defended Winter.
# text = "They filed an emergency motion, and we were not about to let California go dark,'' Hoecker said.
# text = "They (ISO management) did what any independent system operator would do."
# text = What Dunn's committee hopes to learn is why all these events transpired.
# text = He believes memos and e-mails around the time of Winter's Dec. 8 actions should provide vital clues.
# text = "We don't know why he did what he did, but we are eager to find out," Dunn said.
# text = "Terry said he made that filing in the interest of Californians, but I find that argument has no basis in fact.''
# text = We should resurrect Mike Smith's note and get him on the call in the attempt to avoid recreating the wheel on this one.
# text = I can dig it up if you'd like.

# text = (Newsday.com)
# text = It looks like NASA is ready to sour again after it's devastating loss from the Columbia accident which occurred nearly two years ago.
# text = Now, NASA engineers and astronauts are almost giddy with "go" fever as the tentative date for the first launch since the Columbia disaster approaches.
# text = The most important question isn't whether Discovery is technically ready to fly with new safety features and emergency procedures, but whether the agency itself has learned from the crucial errors most common to Challenger and Columbia, errors that grew out of a management culture that discouraged criticism and sacrificed safety for image-puffing and budget-cutting.
# text = I hope so.
# text = Seeing another "Columbia" incident can be quite frightening (I woke up to it early in the morning when I was in Texas).
# text = We don't need another incident as exploring the cosmos is something that keeps our imagination going as a species.
# text = Maybe one day they will allow space tourism, (hopefully that will be in the near future)although I would recommend that NASA build new shuttles instead of trying to preserve the older ones.
# text = You do have to give NASA credit on some things as they have eliminated the "fear of reporting failure" culture that probably led to the lack of reporting defects on the Columbia shuttle.
# text = Instead they are encouraging everyone to come forward if they see any potential problems (as it is clear that overlooked problems could result in unnecessary losses).
# text = But supporters are pointing a few good things out:
# text = Clearly, the agency has worked hard at tackling the technical challenges posed by a superb and surprisingly independent-minded investigative panel.
# text = A few weeks ago, shuttle workers at the Kennedy Space Center received a rocket-like boost in morale with two important deliveries for the next shuttle to carry.
# text = One is a special tool to detect damage to the thermal-protective tile while in orbit - something the Columbia crew would have welcomed.
# text = The other is a new fuel tank "guaranteed" by NASA not to shed potentially fatal hunks of insulation.
# text = NASA has some PR hurdles to overcome in the future.
# text = But lets hope for their sake (and the sake of all space lovers out there) that they can redefine their image and rekindle the hope of space colonization again.

# text = The eighteen steps of the dance are done rhythmically.
# text = First the dancer begins in the starting position: the hands together and raised over the head.
# text = Then to the beat of "dhin, dhin,... ,ta', ta'", the dancers begin their step, placing the big toe behind the heel of the other foot.
# text = In the final two steps, the dancers firmly stamp their feet on the ground.
# text = Kaoshikii can be danced for as many rounds as you like.
# text = --
# text = The Ideation
# text = When the dancers start the step with the beat of "dhin, dhin...", the mental ideation should also be kept.
# text = Here is the ideation.
# text = The two hands when upraised and folded together represent: "Now I am trying to establish a link with Parama Purus'a (Supreme Consciousness)."
# text = Bending to the right indicates: "I know the right way to request You."
# text = Bending to the left indicates: "I know how to fulfil Your demands."
# text = Bending forward suggests: "I completely surrender to You."
# text = Bending backward represents: "I am ready to face all obstacles that may come."
# text = The last two steps represent: "O Lord I repeat Your cosmic rhythm."
# text = Quebecker wins U.S. bravery award
# text = Pittsburgh -
# text = A Quebec man was awarded a Carnegie Medal for bravery on Monday for saving two friends by fighting off a polar bear with a pocket knife two years ago on Baffin Island
# text = Dr. Eric Fortier, 34, of Gatineau, Que., used a pocket knife to attack a polar bear on Baffin Island, just south of the Arctic Circle, to save two friends who were being mauled.
# text = "All of the research and all of the preparation I did leading up to the trip gave no indication that there were bears in the Soper [River] valley where we were canoeing," Dr. Fortier said.
# text = Dr. Fortier, an orthodontist, learned there was at least one polar bear in the central region of Baffin Island in July 2001 when he felt what he thought was a dog leaning on his tent wall.
# text = "My first thought was to push it away," he said.
# text = "A few seconds later my girlfriend saw the shadow of a bear's paw through the tent fly and then it started ripping through the ceiling."
# text = The polar bear is more dangerous than most other bears.
# text = The latter usually consider human beings a threat but the polar bear considers humans a snack, experts said.
# text = The two screamed to frighten the bear and warn their friends in a tent several metres away but the bear ripped into that tent and began mauling 31-year-old Alain Parenteau.
# text = "Their screams changed," Dr. Fortier said.
# text = "I grabbed my glasses and my knife and unzipped my tent and headed out."
# text = The bear dwarfed the 6-foot-1 Mr. Parenteau, knocking him to the ground, he said.
# text = Dr. Fortier threw a large rock at the bear, distracting it and allowing Parenteau to escape but it then turned on 25-year-old Patricia Doyon, who was in the same tent.
# text = Again Dr. Fortier threw rocks at the bear and again its target was able to escape.
# text = "The bear gave chase and I gave chase," he said.
# text = "At some point, Patricia tripped or the bear tripped her and was at her back.
# text = I was beside the bear's head and I stabbed it with an upper cut below the jaw in the neck a couple of times."
# text = The bear ran off.
# text = While there was some fur and blood on the nine-centimetre blade, Dr. Fortier said he doesn't think he hurt the bear badly.
# text = Both Mr. Parenteau and Ms. Doyon, however, were bleeding badly.
# text = Dr. Fortier and his girlfriend lashed two canoes together and paddled eight kilometres along the Soper River.
# text = Dr. Fortier travelled another three kilometres by foot to seek help in the nearest settlement.
# text = Both Mr. Parenteau and Ms. Doyon were airlifted to a hospital and survived, though Mr. Parenteau had a gash within a centimetre of his jugular, Dr. Fortier said.
# text = Dr. Fortier was one of 15 people to receive the Carnegie Medal on Monday.
# text = The bronze medal is given to people who "risk their lives to an extraordinary degree while saving or attempting to save the lives of others."
# text = The other Canadian recipient of the medal was Ronald Joseph Crawford, 42, of Hamilton, who was killed Aug. 4, 2002, while trying to defend a Hamilton sandwich shop owner from a robber wielding a knife.
# text = Mr. Crawford threw several punches at the assailant before he was stabbed in the heart.
# text = U.S. industrialist Andrew Carnegie started a hero fund in 1904 after being inspired by rescue stories from a mine disaster that killed 181 people.
# text = The award comes with a $3,500 (U.S.) grant.
# text = Important information of big companies
# text = Apple Computers
# text = It was the favorite fruit of founder Steve Jobs.
# text = He was three months late in filing a name for the business, and he threatened to call his company Apple Computers if the other colleagues didn't suggest a better name by 5 O'clock.
# text = CISCO
# text = It is not an acronym as popularly believed.
# text = It is short for San Francisco.
# text = Compaq
# text = This name was formed by using COMp, for computer, and PAQ to denote a small integral object.
# text = Corel
# text = The name was derived from the founder's name Dr.Michael Cowpland.
# text = It stands for COwpland REsearch Laboratory.
# text = Google
# text = The name started as a joke boasting about the amount of information the search-engine would be able to search.
# text = It was originally named 'Googol', a word for the number represented by 1 followed by 100 zeros.
# text = After founders - Stanford graduate students Sergey Brin and Larry Page presented their project to an angel investor, they received a cheque made out to 'Google'
# text = Hotmail
# text = Founder Jack Smith got the idea of accessing e-mail via the web from a computer anywhere in the world.
# text = When Sabeer Bhatia came up with the business plan for the mail service, he tried all kinds of names ending in 'mail' and finally settled for hotmail as it included the letters "html" - the programming language used to write web pages.
# text = It was initially referred to as HoTMaiL with selective uppercasing.
# text = Hewlett Packard
# text = Bill Hewlett and Dave Packard tossed a coin to decidewhether the company they founded would be called Hewlett-Packard or Packard-Hewlett.
# text = Intel
# text = Bob Noyce and Gordon Moore wanted to name their new company 'Moore Noyce' but that was already trademarked by a hotel chain so they had to settle for an acronym of INTegrated ELectronics.
# text = Lotus (Notes)
# text = Mitch Kapor got the name for his company from 'The Lotus Position' or 'Padmasana'.
# text = Kapor used to be a teacher of Transcendental Meditation of Maharishi Mahesh Yogi.
# text = Microsoft
# text = Coined by Bill Gates to represent the company that was devoted to MICROcomputer SOFTware.
# text = Originally christened Micro-Soft, the '-' was removed later on.
# text = Motorola
# text = Founder Paul Galvin came up with this name when his company started manufacturing radios for cars.
# text = The popular radio company at the time was called Victrola.
# text = ORACLE
# text = Larry Ellison and Bob Oats were working on a consulting project for the CIA (Central Intelligence Agency).
# text = The code name for the project was called Oracle (the CIA saw this as the system to give answers to all questions or something such).
# text = The project was designed to help use the newly written SQL code by IBM.
# text = The project eventually was terminated but Larry and Bob decided to finish what they started and bring it to the world.
# text = They kept the name Oracle and created the RDBMS engine.
# text = Later they kept the same name for the company.
# text = Sony
# text = It originated from the Latin word 'sonus' meaning sound, and 'sonny' a slang used by Americans to refer to a bright youngster.
# text = SUN
# text = Founded by 4 Stanford University buddies, SUN is the acronym for Stanford University Network.
# text = Yahoo!
# text = The word was invented by Jonathan Swift and used in his book 'Gulliver's Travels'.
# text = It represents a person who is repulsive in appearance and action and is barely human.
# text = Yahoo! Founders Jerry Yang and DavidFilo selected the name because they considered themselves yahoos...
# text = I am on Yahoo !
# text = Email : mayur...@yahoo.com SMS : +919819602175 Web :

# text = Dear Sir / Madam,
# text = I am GEORGE WALKER BUSH, son of the former president of the United States of America George Herbert Walker Bush, and currently serving as President of the United States of America.
# text = This letter might surprise you because we have not met neither in person nor by correspondence.
# text = I came to know of you in my search for a reliable and reputable person to handle a very confidential business transaction, which involves the transfer of a huge sum of money to an account requiring maximum confidence.
# text = I am writing you in absolute confidence primarily to seek your assistance in acquiring oil funds that are presently trapped in the republic of Iraq.
# text = My partners and I solicit your assistance in completing a transaction begun by my father, who has long been actively engaged in the extraction of petroleum in the United States of America, and bravely served his country as director of the United States Central Intelligence Agency.
# text = In the decade of the nineteen-eighties, my father, then vice-president of the United States of America, sought to work with the good offices of the President of the Republic of Iraq to regain lost oil revenue sources in the neighboring Islamic republic of Iran.
# text = This unsuccessful venture was soon followed by a falling-out with his Iraqi partner, who sought to acquire additional oil revenue sources in the neighboring emirate of Kuwait, a wholly-owned U.S.-British subsidiary.
# text = My father re-secured the petroleum assets of Kuwait in 1991 at a cost of sixty-one billion U.S. dollars ($61,000,000,000).
# text = But my father's former Iraqi business partner remained in control of the republic of Iraq and its petroleum reserves.
# text = My family is calling for your urgent assistance in funding the removal of the President of the Republic of Iraq and acquiring the petroleum assets of his country, as compensation for the costs of removing him from power.
# text = Unfortunately, our partners from 1991 are not willing to shoulder the burden of this new venture, which in its upcoming phase may cost the sum of 100 billion to 200 billion dollars ($100,000,000,000 - $200,000,000,000), both in the initial acquisition and in long-term management.
# text = Without the funds from our 1991 partners, we would not be able to acquire the oil revenue trapped within Iraq.
# text = That is why my family and our colleagues are urgently seeking your gracious assistance.
# text = Our distinguished colleagues in this business transaction include the sitting vice-president of the United States of America, Richard Cheney, who is an original partner in the Iraq venture and former head of the Halliburton oil company, and Condoleeza Rice, whose professional dedication to the venture was demonstrated in the naming of a Chevron oil tanker after her.
# text = I would beseech you to transfer a sum equaling ten to twenty-five percent(10-25 %) of your yearly income to our account to aid in this important venture.
# text = The Internal Revenue Service of the United States of America will function as our trusted intermediary.
# text = I propose that you make this transfer before the fifteenth (15th) of the month of April.
# text = I know that a transaction of this magnitude would make anyone apprehensive and worried.
# text = But I am assuring you that all will be well at the end of the day.
# text = A bold step taken shall not be regretted, I assure you.
# text = Please do be informed that this business transaction is 100% legal.
# text = If you do not wish to co-operate in this transaction, please contact our intermediary representatives to further discuss the matter.
# text = I pray that you understand our plight.
# text = My family and our colleagues will be forever grateful.

# text = Q: NASA IS A WASTE!
# text = ( Answered, 2 Comments )
# text = Question
# text = Subject: NASA IS A WASTE!
# text = Category: Science > Astronomy
# text = Asked by: yheggy-ga
# text = List Price: $2.00
# text = Posted: 25 Oct 2004 18:32 PDT
# text = Expires: 24 Nov 2004 17:32 PST
# text = Question ID: 420072
# text = How much money does the USA give NASA per year?
# text = Answer
# text = Subject: Re: NASA IS A WASTE!
# text = Answered By: googlenut-ga on 25 Oct 2004 19:14 PDT
# text = Hello yheggy-ga,
# text = On September 21, 2004, the U.S. Senate Appropriations Committee approved $16.379 billion in funding for NASA for fiscal year 2005.
# text = This is a $200 million increase over what NASA received for fiscal year 2004.
# text = U.S. Senate Committee on Appropriations
# text = Press Release
# text = September 21, 2004
# text = "National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA): is funded at $16.379 billion, an increase of $200 million over the FY04 enacted level, and a reduction of $665 million from the budget request.
# text = An additional $800 million in emergency funding was added for NASA during the Committee's consideration of the bill.
# text = -- The return to flight activities for the Shuttle program are funded at $4.319 billion, the requested level from the Administration.
# text = -- The International Space Station is funded at $1.6 billion.
# text = The bill reduces ISS operations by $120 million due to the continued reduced capability of the ISS for at least half of FY05.
# text = -- The Moon/Mars vision:
# text = --- The Crew Exploration Vehicle (CEV) is funded at $268 million.
# text = --- A lunar exploration mission is funded at $20 million.
# text = --- $10 million is provided for Centennial Challenges.
# text = Neighborhood Reinvestment Corporation (NRC): is funded at $115 million, the same as FY04 and the budget request."
# text = Spacetoday.net
# text = Senate increases NASA funding
# text = "The Senate Appropriations Committee used a somewhat controversial technique Tuesday to increase NASA's fiscal year 2005 budget by $200 million over what President Bush requested.
# text = The committee voted to give NASA $16.4 billion in 2005, about $200 million more than what the President requested and over $1 billion more than what House appropriators approved in July."
# text = I hope you have found this information helpful.
# text = If you have any questions, please request clarification prior to rating the answer.
# text = Googlenut
# text = Google Search Terms:
# text = nasa funding

# text = By Richard Spencer
# text = (Filed: 19/11/2004)
# text = China's insatiable demand for energy is prompting fears of financial and diplomatic collisions around the globe as it seeks reliable supplies of oil from as far away as Brazil and Sudan.
# text = An intrusion into Japanese territorial waters by a Chinese nuclear submarine last week and a trade deal with Brazil are the latest apparently unconnected consequences of China's soaring economic growth.
# text = Increased car usage in China is creating a high demand for petrol
# text = The connection, however, lies in an order issued last year by President Hu Jintao to seek secure oil supplies abroad - preferably ones which could not be stopped by America in case of conflict over Taiwan.
# text = The submarine incident was put down to a "technical error" by the Chinese government, which apologised to Japan.
# text = But even before the incident the People's Daily, the government mouthpiece, had commented that competition over the East China Sea between the two countries was "only a prelude of the game between China and Japan in the arena of international energy".
# text = The Brazil trade deal included funding for a joint oil-drilling and pipeline programme at a cost that experts said would add up to three times the cost of simply buying oil on the market.
# text = The West, however, has paid little attention to these developments.
# text = For the United States and Europe are far more concerned with the even more sensitive issues of China's relations with "pariah states".
# text = In September, China threatened to veto any move to impose sanctions on Sudan over the atrocities in Darfur.
# text = It has invested $3 billion in the African country's oil industry, which supplies it with seven per cent of its needs.
# text = Then, this month, it said that it opposed moves to refer Iran's nuclear stand-off with the International Atomic Energy Agency to the United Nations Security Council.
# text = A week before, China's second biggest state oil firm had signed a $70 billion deal for oilfield and natural gas development with Iran, which already supplies 13 per cent of China's needs.
# text = China has its own reserves of oil and natural gas and once was a net oil exporter.
# text = But as its economy has expanded by an average of nine per cent per year for the last two decades, so has its demand for energy.
# text = This year it overtook Japan as the world's second largest consumer of energy, behind the US.
# text = Its projected demand, boosted by a huge rise in car ownership as well as the need to find alternatives to polluting coal for electricity generation, has contributed to the surge in the price of oil this year.
# text = Shortages are already leading to power cuts in the big cities.
# text = Since President Hu ordered state-owned oil firms to "go abroad" to ensure supply, they have begun drilling for gas in the East China Sea, just west of the line that Japan regards as its border.
# text = Japan protested, to no avail, that the project should be a joint one.
# text = The two are also set to clash over Russia's oil wealth.
# text = China is furious that Japan has outbid it in their battle to determine the route of the pipeline that Russia intends to build to the Far East.
# text = Japan favoured a route to the sea, enabling oil to be shipped to both Japan and China.
# text = China wanted an overland route through its own territory, which would give it ultimate control if hostilities broke out.
# text = Increasingly, analysts are saying that China's efforts have gone beyond what is safe or even in its own interests.
# text = Claude Mandil, the executive director of the International Energy Agency in Paris, said the reserves in the East China Sea were hardly worth the trouble.
# text = "Nobody thinks that there will be a lot of oil and gas in this part of the world," he said.
# text = "It may be a difficult political issue but I don't think the energy content is worthwhile."
# text = Eurasia Group, a New York-based firm of political analysts, said its oil experts worked out that China was paying such an inflated price for its investment in Brazil that the cost for the oil it ended up with was three times the market price.
# text = "If China's economy falters, which, in my view, appears increasingly likely, then commodity prices will plummet, and with them, the value of the assets that produce them," Jason Kindopp, Eurasia's lead China analyst, said.
# text = "Beijing may end up in a early 1990s Japan situation, where it is forced to sell recently purchased overseas assets for a fraction of what it paid for them."
# text = China's wider aggression to secure oil and gas was the greatest threat to its international standing in the next decade.
# text = "Sudan is the primary example," he said.
# text = "It marks the first time in recent years that China has promised to wield its veto power in the UN Security Council against a petition initiated by the United States and backed by France and Great Britain."
# text = Email: dharmad...@gmail.com
# text = Visualizations as a helpful beginning technique
# text = -----------------------------------------------
# text = If you consider that you still need the assistance of other visualizations to help the mind feel the spirit of transcendence, try the following before moving onto the more formal method below.
# text = Visualisations can be as useful tools, but meditation is more than that.
# text = Meditation has to do with what is called ideation.
# text = It is always good to stick to a formal intense meditation practice like the one for beginners described in the MP3 file that follows after the visualisations.
# text = Find a comfortable place on the floor and sit with your legs crossed.
# text = Your breathing should be calm and relaxed, through the nose.
# text = Spend a minute or so concentrating on your breath, feeling the air flowing through your nostrils.
# text = 1. Warm Sun Visualization
# text = Continue to breathe slowly and deeply.
# text = With each breath, feel the muscles in your body becoming lighter and lighter, and also your external motor and sensory organs are feeling like they are withdrawing from the world into a special inner quietness.
# text = Imagine the tension melting away as you continue breathing rhythmically and naturally.
# text = Picture yourself sitting on a warm, tropical beach basking in the glow of the sun ... .
# text = Visualize the vivid, beautiful colours of the earth (its flowers and plants), the sea next to you, and the sky above you.
# text = Feel yourself floating above the earth and sea.
# text = As you sit above the world, the warmth of the golden sun penetrates your body and makes you feel warmer and warmer.
# text = It surrounds you.
# text = The golden rays feel soft and soothing.
# text = Now you are far above the earth - into space.
# text = Everything around you is so vast.
# text = Yet, there is warmth and a familiarity with the vastness.
# text = You want to merge your mind with the greater universal Mind that surrounds you.
# text = And while doing so continue using the Baba Nam Kevalam mantra (breathe in with Baba Nam, breathe out with Kevalam).
# text = Try this for 5 to 10 minutes.
# text = Now come back to earth again - slowly.
# text = Imagine yourself sitting on the beach serenely and restfully.
# text = Your muscles are loose and limp.
# text = Feel your body sinking slightly into the sand making that earthly connection again.
# text = The sun's rays and warmth are still with you, surrounding you.
# text = You are in a state of peace and relaxation.
# text = With each breath, watch your body and ensure that it remains relaxed - at peace.
# text = Continue to feel the warmth of the sunlight all over your body, warming you deeply and gently.
# text = You want to bring something back with you from your deep space experience where you sensed your mind merging with the universal Mind.
# text = This will be the warmth of the sun - a close reminder and link between earth and the infinite space.
# text = Visualize the inside of your body bathed in the golden light, absorbing every ray and glowing as radiantly as the sun.
# text = A warm, gentle breeze swirls around your body and relaxes you even more .
# text = Let your mind and body be totally at peace.
# text = Now feel yourself returning to where you sit ... move your hands and feet a little, stretch them.
# text = Open your eyes.
# text = 2. Mountain Visualization
# text = Another thing you can try.
# text = Imagine you're sitting on top of a mountain, and that it's the most peaceful place you can think of.
# text = Feel that you're sitting there in complete peace, right on top of the world.
# text = Now imagine that infinite happiness is surrounding you in every direction.
# text = Feel you're completely surrounded by that infinite peace and happiness.
# text = Now start to repeat within your mind the mantra: BABA NAM KEVALAM.
# text = Its meaning is "Infinite happiness is everywhere".
# text = Feel the meaning, don't just think of its wordy meaning or try to translate from Sanskrit (BABA NAM KEVALAM) to an English meaning (Infinite peace and happiness).
# text = Think internally, intuitively, not by words, of the meaning, as you're repeating it.
# text = This is called ideation.
# text = It is important to take the idea, not just the intellectual analysis.
# text = Touching deep into the idea is what builds intuition - it is a synthetic process.
# text = Whereas, trying to translate and grapple with wordy meanings is an intellectual mechanism - an analytical process.
# text = Feel you're surrounded by infinite peace and happiness, and feel that your own sense of existence is in direct contact with that endless peace and happiness all around you.
# text = You can go further and feel that your unit consciousness, a dot in the Infinite Consciousness, is merging with Infinity.
# text = Continue for as long as you like, then open your eyes.
# text = OK that is fairly basic :).
# text = The important point is to develop some psycho-spiritual connection between your mind and the universal Consciousness or Supreme Consciousness.
# text = Don't worry if you have trouble concentrating on the mantra and ideation - that's normal.
# text = It takes some time and practice to be able to focus on the one thought.
# text = The main thing is to keep practicing.
# text = If you don't practice, then nothing happens.
# text = Well maybe a miracle could happen, but lets face it we're ordinary people and so require practical day to day techniques!
# text = ---
# text = NORTH CAROLINA RELIGIOUS COALITION FOR MARRIAGE EQUALITY
# text = From what we hear from the news media, one could easily conclude that all Christians are opposed to gay marriage.
# text = But that’s not the case.
# text = Last year an organization named the North Carolina Religious Coalition for Marriage Equality was formed to get out the message that at least some people of faith are not opposed to extending the rights and responsibilities of civil marriage to same-gender couples.
# text = One of “NCRC4ME’s” major efforts is to collect signatures for the attached “Declaration of Religious Leaders,” which has been and will again be presented to members of the NC legislature.
# text = It presents the case for marriage equality and states, “We are resolved that the State should not interfere with same-gender couples who choose to marry and share fully and equally in the rights, responsibilities, and commitments of civil marriage.”
# text = A measure to amend the NC Constitution to ban gay marriage was defeated last year but already has been reintroduced in the 2005 legislative session, so there is a real need for visible support for the “pro-same-gender-marriage” side of this issue.
# text = At its February meeting the CHS Vestry voted unanimously to add their names to the Declaration.
# text = Our Rector Barbara and our Deacon Clare also have signed the Declaration.
# text = Furthermore, the Vestry voted unanimously to invite the support of members of the CHS congregation for the Declaration.
# text = (Since the Declaration is written as coming from “religious leaders,” people who don’t consider themselves “religious leaders” can sign as “Supporters of the North Carolina Religious Coalition for Marriage Equality.”)
# text = Please note that the Declaration addresses only civil marriage; it says nothing about religious beliefs or practices regarding marriage.
# text = If you have any questions please feel free to call me (after Sat. the 26th, when I will return from a trip).
# text = Sign-up lists will be available at the services on Feb. 27 and March 6, or you can email me.
# text = I will email names and email addresses (or postal addresses) of signers to NCRC4ME in time for their “lobby day” in Raleigh on March 15.
# text = Thank you for your consideration of this issue.
# text = For the Church of the Holy Spirit Vestry,
# text = Dudley Cate 828-296-8466 jodud...@aol.com
# text = ---------------------------
# text = North Carolina Religious Coalition for Marriage Equality Declaration of Religious Leaders April 19, 2004
# text = The most fundamental human right, after the necessities of food, clothing and shelter, is the right to affection and the supportive love of other human beings.
# text = We become most fully human when we love another person.
# text = We can grow in our capacity to be human - to be loving - in a family unit.
# text = This right to love and form a family is so fundamental that our United States Constitution takes it for granted in its dedication to "secure the blessings of liberty to ourselves and our posterity.”
# text = The North Carolina Constitution likewise affirms the “inalienable rights” of human beings to "life, liberty, the enjoyment of the fruits of their own labor, and the pursuit of happiness."
# text = Throughout history, tyrants have known that by denying the right of oppressed peoples to form and nurture families, they can kill the spirit of those peoples.
# text = >From the shameful history of slavery in America, the injustice of forbidding people to marry is evident as a denial of a basic human right.
# text = The American laws forbidding interracial marriage, now struck down, were clearly discriminatory.
# text = Denial of the status of marriage to those who would freely accept its responsibilities creates legal and economic inequities and social injustice.
# text = We feel called to protest and oppose this injustice.
# text = As religious people, clergy and lay leaders, we are mandated by faith to stand for justice in our common civic life.
# text = We oppose the use of sacred texts and religious traditions to deny legal equity to same-gender couples.
# text = As concerned citizens we affirm the liberty of adults of the same gender to love and marry.
# text = We insist that no one, especially the state, is allowed to coerce people into marriage or bar two consenting adults, whether of the same or differing genders, from forming the family unit that lets them be more fully loving, thus more fully human.
# text = We respect the fact that debate and discussion continue in many of our religious communities as to the scriptural, theological and liturgical issues involved.
# text = However, we draw on our many faith traditions to arrive at a common conviction.
# text = We are resolved that the State should not interfere with same-gender couples who choose to marry and share fully and equally in the rights, responsibilities, and commitments of civil marriage.
# text = We affirm freedom of conscience in this matter.
# text = We recognize that the state may not require religious groups to officiate at, or bless, same-gender marriages.
# text = Likewise, a denial of state civil recognition dishonors the religious convictions of those communities and clergy who officiate at, and bless, same-gender marriages.
# text = The state may not favor the convictions of one religious group over another by denying individuals their fundamental right to marry and to have those marriages recognized by civil law.
# text = As faith leaders, we commit ourselves to public action, visibility, education, and mutual support in the service of the right and freedom to marry.
# text = --
# text = Tom Dempsey Gulf Breeze, FL 850-748-0740
# text = Email: Bill McGinnis <bmc...@patriot.net>
# text = The One Reason Why All Americans Should Oppose The Nomination Of Samuel Alito
# text = He Would Tear Down Our System Of Checks And Balances, Giving Far Too Much Power To The President
# text = My Fellow Americans:
# text = As many of you may have heard, President Bush has nominated a long-time Federal Judge named Samuel Alito to become the next member of the United States Supreme Court, to fill a vacancy created by the retirement of another member of the Court.
# text = Under our Constitution, this nomination cannot take effect unless and until the United States Senate gives its Consent, as described in our Constitution, Article II, Section 2.
# text = A copy of the Constitution, with links back to the official source, is located at http://loveallpeople.org/usconstitutiona.txt
# text = Judge Samuel Alito is very highly qualified by all of the normal standards used to evaluate candidates for this position:
# text = He has a very high intellect.
# text = He graduated very high in his class, from Princeton undergraduate and from Law School at Yale.
# text = He has a long and distinguished record, including many years as a Federal Appeals Judge, the next level below Supreme Court.
# text = He has encyclopedic knowledge of hundreds of different Supreme Court cases, and he can recite details from memory.
# text = He demonstrates an excellent "Judicial Temperament," being courteous, mild-mannered, respectful of all people; careful in his work, meticulous in detail.
# text = His co-workers love him.
# text = His fellow judges love him.
# text = His family loves him.
# text = President Bush loves him.
# text = Yes, it is true that some people don't like the way they think he will vote on the Supreme Court.
# text = But other people do like the way they think he will vote, and the ones who favor him seem to outnumber the ones who oppose him.
# text = So now the Senate is getting ready to vote soon, on whether to approve him or not; and at this moment (evening of Jan. 27, 2006) it looks like he has more than the fifty-one votes needed for approval.
# text = The President is very eager to go ahead quickly and get this vote, because he very much wants to have Samuel Alito on the Supreme Court, to be judging the cases Bush is interested in.
# text = So there is a lot of hurry-up pressure on the Senate to give its prompt vote of approval.
# text = There is an old saying that applies in this situation: "Act in haste, repent at leisure."
# text = Sometimes you can make a bad decision very quickly, then regret it for many years to come.
# text = That is what is about to happen with Judge Samuel Alito, in my opinion, because he has one tragic flaw - a very serious blind spot in his thinking - which makes him completely unacceptable for the position of Supreme Court Justice: He does not really agree with the system of "Checks and Balances" built into the Constitution, and he is ready to start tearing it down in order to follow the "Unitary Executive Theory," which calls for vastly-increased Presidential Power at the expense of Congress and the Supreme Court.
# text = And because of this tragic flaw . . .
# text = "He Would Tear Down Our System Of Checks And Balances, Giving Far Too Much Power To The President."
# text = In our Constitutional system, we have three branches of the Federal Government: the Legislative, Executive, and Judicial branches.
# text = And the basic idea behind the Checks and Balances we have is that if one branch of the Government goes crazy, the other two can hold it down.
# text = But Samuel Alito believes in a little-known Constitutional theory - called the "Unitary Executive Theory" - which says that the President should have complete control over the Executive Branch, and that the Executive Branch should be in charge of almost everything that the Government actually does, including the functions of the Independent Agencies which were designed to be free of Presidential control, and the Military, which exists, which is regulated, and which is funded by specific authority given by the Constitution to Congress, not to the President.
# text = The Military is not part of the Executive Branch: it is a separate entity.
# text = Under the Unitary Executive Theory, the Laws of Congress and Decisions of the Supreme Court have no actual authority unless the President agrees with them.
# text = And so Congress and the Supreme Court become mere advisors to the President, with no real authority over him.
# text = And the President becomes a Dictator, unrestrained by anything in the Constitution, backed up by the Armed Forces, which would be entirely under his personal control.
# text = And thus the United States of America - The Land Of The Free And The Home Of The Brave - becomes just another Military Dictatorship, no better than Nazi Germany or Fascist Italy during World War II.
# text = AND THAT IS WHY ALL AMERICANS SHOULD OPPOSE THE NOMINATION OF SAMUEL ALITO.
# text = For details and further proof, please see these websites:
# text = Testimony at http://judiciary.senate.gov/testimony.cfm?id=1725&wit_id=4905
# text = Descriptions and Links at http://www.UnitaryExecutive.net
# text = Blessings to you.
# text = May God help us all.
# text = And may God bless America!
# text = Rev. Bill McGinnis, Director http://www.LoveAllPeople.org and http://www.InternetchurchOfChrist.org

# text = If you want to help, please send them to everyone you know who needs to read them.

# text = NASA & Company Diplomacy - Trying to keep Moon Landing Hoax a secret in modern times
# text = Some strategies being used by NASA & Company in relation to China and other space planning countries are mentioned here after being gleaned from a news item underneath.
# text = Country has an Independent strategy = NASA & company to use "Numero Uno" strategy, try to assert, beat, mesh and control the space program of the country.
# text = This can also be through political, economical, social, and technological influence.
# text = Country not open or not have fixed strategy = NASA & Company to use "freeze thawed" strategy especially when the country has a challenging, growing and ambitious space program.
# text = This can also be through political, economical, social, and technological influence.
# text = Dependant = NASA & Company to use "space station" model to unify the aims of different countries.
# text = This is really an end goal aim of NASA & Company and also does not allow anyone challenging the moon landing hoax.
# text = The target for NASA & Company probably to get by 2018 all the ambitious space program countries shifting towards this model, through the propaganda of another moon mission; deliberately failing this or trying hard for another moon landing hoax; achieving the real aim of space unity between space programs of other countries.
# text = China launches its second manned spaceflight mission
# text = Secretive efforts keep outsiders in the dark about the program's goals
# text = By MARK CARREAU
# text = Copyright 2005 Houston Chronicle
# text = Reuters
# text = China launched Shenzhou VI, its second manned spacecraft, early today in northwest China's Gansu Province.
# text = A pair of military pilots embarked on China's second manned space flight early today, hurtling into orbit on a test mission that could span five days.
# text = The crew of the Shenzhou VI spacecraft was identified as Fei Junlong, 40, and Nie Haishen, 41, by China's official news agency.
# text = The successful launch from the Jiuquan Satellite Launch Center in northwest China follows the solo flight of Yang Liwei in October 2003.
# text = His one-day mission vaulted his communist homeland into the elite circle of spacefaring nations - Russia and the United States - that can launch and sustain humans in space.
# text = Most experts believe China intends to develop a small space station of its own over the next several years.
# text = But they remain uncertain about whether China aims to beat the United States to the moon in its secretive space effort.
# text = President Bush has directed NASA to return to the moon by 2018 with a new generation of human explorers.
# text = China's "is not a fly-by-night program," said Joan Johnson-Freese, an expert on national security who follows space developments in the Asian nation at the Naval War College in Newport, R.I.
# text = "They are not in any hurry.
# text = They want a program that will be a success," Johnson-Freese said.
# text = "They are not going to rush it, because they don't want it to be a budget buster.
# text = Economics will be a big determiner in the speed of their program."
# text = China's overtures to join the U.S.-led effort to develop the 16-nation international space station have been thwarted for more than a decade over a range of issues, including the Asian country's human rights policies and worries it could acquire technologies that could pose a security threat.
# text = The freeze thawed some after Yang's 2003 mission.
# text = China was among 30 nations invited to send a delegate to NASA-sponsored roundtable discussions on Bush's strategy to reach the moon with astronauts as the first step in the exploration of Mars and other-deep space destinations.
# text = "We applaud China's space achievements," NASA spokesman Allard Beutel said Tuesday.
# text = "We wish them a successful return of their astronauts."
# text = He stressed, however, that NASA would not follow this week's Chinese mission through formal channels.
# text = At present, there are no plans for additional meetings with foreign powers to discuss the Bush exploration initiative or to extend an invitation to China to join the space station partnership, Beutel said.
# text = The flight of Fei and Nie could mark the end of the opening chapter in a three-phase Chinese space initiative, Johnson-Freese said.
# text = The first phase, she said, will demonstrate the capability of a multi-compartment spacecraft that will leave a test module in orbit when the two fliers return to Earth.
# text = The Chinese program's second phase will include spacewalks on future missions and demonstrations of docking and undocking techniques.
# text = The final phase will feature the assembly and operation of a longer-duration space lab.
# text = At least one expert believes China's intentions might include a surprise attempt to circle the moon with astronauts before NASA's planned lunar return.
# text = "The Americans would be wise to plan accordingly," said John E. Pike, director of the Alexandria, Va.-based GlobalSecurity.org, a small national security think tank.
# text = "There is always the possibility they could jam us up, make us look like we are not numero uno," Pike said.
# text = During the U.S. and Russian lunar race during the Cold War, NASA scored an early coup by circling the moon with the Apollo 8 crew over the 1968 Christmas holidays.
# text = As it turned out, the Soviets never made it to the moon.
# text = "(China) could be the second country to do that," Pike said.
# text = "They would get in line in front of the Russians.
# text = And they would not have to land on the moon to take us down a notch."
# text = Pike's concern is based on China's development of a new medium-lift rocket, the Long March V, and the construction of a new space launch complex on Hainan Island in the South China Sea.
# text = The two developments, he said, could eventually enable China's space program to mature to the point that experts could assemble and launch from Earth's orbit a spacecraft capable of circling the moon with astronauts and returning home.
# text = mark.carr...@chron.com
# text = Email: "righter"<righ...@sonic.net>
# text = Groups: alt.animals.rights.promotion, alt.animals, alt.animals.cat, alt.animals.ethics.vegetarian, alt.animals.lion, alt.animals.tiger, alt.animals.felines.diseases, alt.animals.dog, alt.animals.horses.breeding, alt.animals.felines.snowleopards
# text = I'm a member of a local animal rights news, and get regular emails from other members and the staff.
# text = Recently, I read an email that reported the horrific nightmare Civet Cats go through by sick losers who put them in sheds and heat the inside of the sheds up to 110 degrees with fires, so that they can periodically scrape the sweat off of their genitals and sell it to corrupt corporations who use it to prolong the scent of perfumes.
# text = The animals eventually die, which is because these demons are so GREEDY, they want as much of their "product" as they can get, instead of letting the cats go after a point, as an act of humanity, mercy, love.
# text = Below I pasted the email text, and it has a link to a website that automatically plays this song the author of the email created.
# text = It has cat's "Meowing" for the vocals, and you might really find yourself in those furnaces, feeling and thinking those terrible feelings and thoughts that these cats do before they die.
# text = Right now, while we're sitting at our computers enjoying the internet, those innocent, beautiful, loving cats, are dying, somewhere in this troubled world a slow, agonizing death.
# text = The main reason I wrote this post is to ask anyone reading this if they know of some way I can help put a stop to this Cat Holocaust.
# text = I am serious about doing something.
# text = If I love cats so much, why aren't I DOING something???
# text = I don't want to appear before God on judgment day and have to explain why I didn't do anything like this in my life.
# text = Any suggestions would be appreciated.
# text = Here's the text of the email:
# text = Hi there,
# text = I read the Civet Cat story from a little while ago, and tonight, when my Mom emailed me about it, I re-read it, and went to the website with the song the author of the email created.
# text = Well, sure enough, when I heard the cats "Meowing," I imagined the hellish moments these poor beautiful creatures of God were living, what went on in their tiny, sweet little minds, and decided that I want to do something about this torture.
# text = So, if anyone can give me some advice, I'd sure appreciate it!
# text = I think for starters, myself and those of you who believe in God could say a special prayer for them.
# text = I will.
# text = I've pasted the email for those who haven't seen or would like to re-read it.
# text = It's also got the website where the song has been uploaded.
# text = I was thinking, that while I'm sitting here, relaxing and enjoying myself, those poor innocent animals are being cooked to death with heat in those Holocaust-esque death chambers.
# text = And what am I DOING about it?
# text = From: Travis Job <t...@sonic.net>
# text = Date: Thu, 11 Mar 2004 02:39:27 -0800
# text = To: SPAR <s...@sonic.net>
# text = Subject: Civet Cats, James Rachels + a song
# text = This is my first time posting to the list, so I feel somewhat embarrassed by "promoting" a song I wrote, but I think it is fitting because it is directly tied to extreme animal suffering as a result of human lack of empathy, but an abundance of human greed.
# text = I'm not sure if any of you know much about civet cats, but to brief those who might not know, I will quote James Rachels, author of World Hunger and Moral Obligation among many other animal rights-related books and articles.
# text = (I kind of see him to be for animal rights theory as Peter Singer is to the theory of utilitarianism applied to non-human animals).
# text = The quote is from an article entitled "Vegetarianism and `The Other Weight Problem'"
# text = If anyone wants the complete article, email me, as it is a very good article which no meat-eater can read and not sense their own hypocrisy.
# text = But this is what he says about civet cats:
# text = "As an example, consider the treatment of the civet cat, a highly intelligent and sociable animal.
# text = Civet cats are trapped and placed in small cages inside darkened sheds, where the temperature is kept up to 110 F by fires.
# text = They are confined in this way until they finally die.
# text = What justifies this extraordinary mistreatment?
# text = These animals have the misfortune to produce a substance that is useful in the manufacture of perfume.
# text = (The heat increases their "production" of musk.)
# text = Here Kant's rule--"Animals are merely means to an end; that end is man"--is applied with a vengeance.
# text = To promote one of the most trivial interests we have, thousands of animals are tormented for their whole lives."
# text = This article, and specifically this piece, effected me enough to try to build a song around the topic.
# text = If anyone is interested in listening to this song, and in offering their opinion, whether it be positive or negative, I'd appreciate it.
# text = But I also hope no one feels any obligation to download, especially if you have an internet connection as slow mine (28k).
# text = The url for the song is http://www.sonic.net/~fsjob/TragiCore-TheCivetCat.mp3
# text = Although there are no human vocals/lyrics, I think it's subject matter is audible.
# text = Again, if anyone wants to read Rachels' entire article, let me know.
# text = It's also on the net.
# text = I was already a vegetarian when I read it a little more than a year ago, but it was one of the bigger factors for me in going completely vegan.
# text = I hope all are well.
# text = Farewell for now...
# text = Travis Job
