# text = There can be many ideas; one can see numerous options passing through their mind.
# text = What is the best option?
# text = Especially if you are planning to spend couple days with family and kids, which best suit you can select?
# text = Disney cruises, is a simple answer to this.
# text = There are many reasons to say Disney cruise is the best bet for you to have a enjoyable holiday tour.
# text = From 1998 onwards, from its inception Disney cruise has attracted many and continue to attract more and more.
# text = This is a spectacular ship, a very popular choice of families to spend their leisure time.
# text = The ship is designed thematically, with imposing animated cartoon characters.
# text = Do you feel that the holidaying with the animated cartoons will impress only young ones?
# text = No, the luxurious facilities and fun filled activities in the Disney cruise are very attractive to people of all ages.
# text = Whatever be the age, you will have the choice of variety of activities to forget about your hectic day-to-day activities.
# text = Kids fun games and video shows are added to the other facilities.
# text = There are two ships, Disney magic and Disney wonder.
# text = Both are made keeping in mind the comforts of the travelers.
# text = Disney cruises offer 24-hour room services, and the crews are ready to serve you the way you like.
# text = It has got very spacious rooms, furnished completely and neatly.
# text = These are decorated uniquely and marvelously.
# text = The ship offers variety of eatables, deliciously made.
# text = Sea fishes, prawns and many nice options are there in different restaurants aboard.
# text = There are many good options of delicious food on the shores as well.
# text = There are special regions uniquely and imposingly designed for the children.
# text = They can spend many hours enjoying the Disney world magic.
# text = These theme parks have all types of facilities.
# text = Video shows, cartoon stories, wonderful games and many such facilities.
# text = It is really an entertainment for the kids.
# text = The amusing world of cartoons and stories will be a memorable experience for the children.
# text = There are other amnesties also.
# text = These include space for dances and music, bar facility, gambling facilities for the elder, spaciously made open area aboard and many such nice facilities.
# text = Also one can keep their privacy in the cabins and make the time in seclusion.
# text = To relax and to rejuvenate Disney cruise are the best option.
# text = There are many online sites offering the booking facility with affordable rates.
# text = You can select the proper route and travel plans by consulting the agents prior to the booking........
# text = Off season is good, however, the Disney cruises are almost ALWAYS completely booked.
# text = I would suggest a warmer season, but not Spring Break or early summer.
# text = You may also want to avoid Thanksgiving week and the Christmas holidays.
# text = We REALLY enjoyed our balcony-- coffee in the mornings, drinks at night, standing outside when docking and leaving port-- however, it is quite a bit more expensive.
# text = With young ones, I would definitely get a window or view room so they can see outside.
# text = Check out the kids' space as soon as you get onboard.
# text = Do NOT feel guilty about taking them there.
# text = They have a BLAST so the sooner they get there, the sooner they can have fun.
# text = We liked getting the late dinner seating, so you have more time to see movies and stuff but if your kids are 'early to bed' you may want the earlier seating for dinners.
# text = Bring some sort of magnet or small magnetic whiteboard for your door.
# text = All of the doors tend to look alike and having 'something' on your door helps you and your kids find your room easier.
# text = You can also leave notes for the rest of your family (husband) about where you are at any given point.
# text = Cell phones do NOT work on board but they give you a 'walkie-talkie' kind of phone in your room that WILL work onboard.
# text = Each evening you will get a 'magazine' called The Navigator which lists all of the activities for the next day.
# text = We always took ours to dinner and discussed what things we felt we 'had' to do and which ones we felt like skipping in lieu of just chilling.
# text = Any time would be great.
# text = off season cruises might actually be better with preschoolers as prices might be lower in the off season.
# text = My wife and I, in our 60's at the time, originally planned a 3 generation trip but some family emergencies caused everyone else to cancel.
# text = We had a ball.
# text = We had an inside cabin and it is what I would recommend.
# text = There are so many things to do that you will only use your room for sleeping and the extra cost of the balcony is wasted.
# text = The children can be checked in and checked out in a safe way at many activities so you can have a bit of free time without the little ones.
# text = The range of activities can be illustrated by describing the water activities.
# text = There is a splash fountain (no standing water) for little ones still in diapers; Next is a wading pool for those who are potty trained; Then a family pool; Finally there is a pool for adults only with kids not allowed.
# text = You will never be so spoiled in your life as you are on a Disney Cruise.
# text = If you stay with your dining schedule, every night is dinner and a show.
# text = The real payoff is that you will have the same waiter for the entire cruise.

# text = As to EPM like Shee said being in MI we've had to deal with it.
# text = Pretty much every large stable has here.
# text = Our first diagnosed EPM horse was back when there was no treatment in the US and only an experimental chicken feed additive in Canada.
# text = We hauled the horse to Windsor and got him treated there.
# text = That horse returned to racing and we didn't notice much difference.
# text = We've had a few since then, but none since our race horses began wintering in Florida.
# text = I have no idea if that is related or farmers are doing a better job of clearing out opossums now because they know opossums are carriers, but we haven't had an EPM horse in at least 10 years.
# text = I can say all of our EPM horses were treated early when they were showing mild signs like Shee gave and all returned to racing.
# text = One horse even got his lifetime mark after being treated for EPM.
# text = We've always liked big long trotters that do better on mile tracks then 1/2 mile.
# text = The only difference we noticed is that the EPM horses seemed to do worse on the smaller tracks after.
# text = It might just be coincidence or the fact those great big trotters with those extremely long backs lost a bit of fine coordination to get those gangly bodies around those tighter turns.

# text = Whatever type of operation they are running, I'm not interested and if you're smart, you won't be either.
# text = What a waste of TIME.
# text = Aside from that little *mystery*, one of the sales ladies was quite comfortable telling me how wrong I was about how another dress that I loved compared to one of her dresses that I was trying on.
# text = Somehow, since she supposedly doesn't know any names of designers/dresses, after I told her the designer and dress name of the one I was comparing, she knew "exactly which dress" I was referring to and disagreed with my observation; she said that the bodice did come as low as the one I had on.
# text = My point: Even if I was wrong, don't sit there and argue with the customer.
# text = Say something like, "Huh.
# text = I didn't think so but you could be right."
# text = Unless you want to take the "tell the customer how wrong she is and try and force her into a dress she's obviously not loving" approach which will likely get you... uh... nowhere.
# text = Seriously: do not waste your time.
# text = Other shops around this city have MUCH NICER and more TRANSPARENT owners.
# text = Not owners that seem like they have something to hide and know nothing about common courtesy and customer service.
# text = I felt very much like Wedding Gallery was being dishonest and I wouldn't trust them to lace me up in another gown let alone trust them with the gown I will wear on the most important day of my life.
# text = AWFUL SERVICE!
# text = After happily visiting Sear's Automotives in the past, I was shocked at the horrible service received at their Greensboro location.
# text = I brought my car in on a Sunday to replace a shredded tire.
# text = I waited about 20 minutes in the store part before anyone was able to assist me and was then told to pull my car into the shop (that is apparently what you are supposed to do, but the big signs pointing you that way are for some reason kept inside the garage, so you don't see them drving up, and they purposely block the front pull-up that all other Sear's use).
# text = Once inside, I had to stand around for at least 10 more minutes before--FINALLY-- a technician got to me.
# text = Once I returned to pick up my car, you can believe I spent quite a bit MORE time standing around waiting.
# text = I had wanted to split the total between a credit card and check card since I was being reimbursed for the tire but was told this wasn't possible.
# text = Once I actually got back in my car, it was dirty and had grease all over the steering wheel.
# text = OK, one bad experience...fine.
# text = The following Friday, I returned with my car to go ahead and replace the other 3 tires, which were worn.
# text = I would not have gone back, but I couldn't find the particular tire they'd used in stock anywhere else.
# text = Once again, I waited for quite a bit before being attended to.
# text = I got the order completed, and then questioned the technician since it came out about $40 less than I expected.
# text = He said it was the same tire, and verified this, after checking both the actual tire on my car and my service papers from earlier in the week.
# text = However, when he printed out the service quote, I could see that it was NOT the correct tire, and was not even an appropriate tire for my car model.
# text = So I pointed this out to him, at which point he said they only had one of the correct tires in stock.
# text = Ok--fine.
# text = So I got just my other rear tire replaced.
# text = They promised it'd be done within an hour, so I waited in the lobby.
# text = Over two hours later (and ten minutes before they closed) my car was finally finished.
# text = A few minutes after I left, I was called and informed that "I" left my wheel lock (which they should have left in the car).
# text = Of course, they would be closing in 5 minutes, so I would have to hurry up or get it the next day.
# text = Of course I couldn't make it back in time (and they apparently could not stay 5 extra minutes to wait for me).
# text = The next day, no one could find my wheel lock and that particular technician was not in.
# text = Of course, they couldn't call him either to ask about it because apparently they don't keep their employees' phone numbers (riiight), so I would have to return on Monday (driving for 3 days now with no wheel lock should I get a flat).
# text = On Monday I called and again it was a big to-do to find anyone who knew anything about it.
# text = Supposedly they will be holding it for me this evening, but I'm sure that will also be a huge ordeal.
# text = The employees at this Sear's are completely apathetic and there didn't seem to be any sort of management that I could see.
# text = I will never return there again (and now have some serious doubts about the quality of work they actually performed on my car).
